project.name: Showdown
project.description: Decentralized poker game with dynamic action card mechanics
project.longDescription: Showdown is 1v1 poker with a twist, featuring collectible action cards, that can swing the tide of the game at any moment.

features.title: Free to play
features.description: access to regular versions of cards available to all players.

features.title: Mobile friendly
features.description: asy to learn, short games full of dopamine.

project.currentStatus: early testing stage. Closed beta coming in Q4 2025.

steps.title: Obtain Access Code
steps.content:
• To access Showdown, you need an invite code. 
 • Invite codes are distributed only to selected users who joined the waitlist with their email. 
 • Codes are sent to a portion of registered emails.

steps.title: Starting a Hand
steps.content:
• Each round (“Hand”), you get 2 pocket cards and 2 action cards (4 on the very first hand).
• You can keep up to 5 action cards, and they carry over to future hands.

steps.title: Action Cards
steps.content:
• Action cards have various effects (change pocket cards, steal chips, interact with opponent, etc.).
• Each card has a Chip value, which is added to the Pot when played.
• The Pot starts with 10 Chips each hand. The goal is to reach 100 Chips.

steps.title: Hand Flow
steps.content:
• Players take turns each stage, either using an action card or checking (passing priority).
• When both players check consecutively, move to the next stage.

steps.title: Stages
steps.content:
• Preflop → Flop (3 community cards revealed) → Option to Fold → If both continue, Pot doubles and move directly to River (2 more community cards).
• Action cards can only be played in certain stages, depending on their color (Green: Preflop, Red: Flop, Blue: River, Grey: any stage).

steps.title: Showdown
steps.content:
• After the River, players reveal their best 5-card poker hand using pocket and community cards.
• The winner takes all Chips in the Pot (split if tied).
• Next hand begins.
